tasks.tutorial: Start in a plank position. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push yourself back up. That's one rep. Keep your back straight!
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips as if sitting in a chair, keeping your chest up and back straight. Go as low as you can, then return to the start.
Hold a push-up position, but with your weight on your forearms instead of your hands. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core!
Safety first! Wear gloves and glasses. Mark your cut line. Use a clamp to secure the wood. Start the cut by pulling the saw towards you gently, then use long, smooth strokes.
You'll need a soldering iron, solder, and flux. Heat the wires with the iron, not the solder. Touch the solder to the heated wires and let it melt and flow over them to create a bond.
A classic challenge! Try using your whole arm and shoulder to draw, not just your wrist. Do it quickly and lightly at first. Practice makes perfect.
In Python, this is one line: print('Hello, World!'). In JavaScript: console.log('Hello, World!');. This is the traditional first step for any programmer.
Fill a pot with water. Place it on a stove burner set to high heat. Wait for large, rolling bubbles to appear. Congratulations, you've boiled water!
Place an egg in a pot of cold water. Bring the water to a boil. For a soft boil, cook for 4-6 minutes. For a hard boil, cook for 10-12 minutes. Immediately place in ice water to stop the cooking.
Boil a large pot of salted water. Add your pasta and stir occasionally. Follow the package instructions for cooking time. Drain the water and serve!
Fill a small pot with soil. Press the seed about half an inch deep. Cover lightly with soil, water it, and place it in a sunny spot.
